p: Mice were divided into groups of six animals to receive one of the following treatments: vehicle (0.5% tween 80 in saline solution), the reference drug clonazepam (0.5 mg/kg, p.o.) and the organic extracts (hexane, ethyl acetate or methanol at 300 mg/kg, p.o.) or the neo-clerodane diterpene (0.1, 1 or 10 mg/kg, p.o.). Thirty minutes after the treatment, animals were consecutively tested in the anxiety models, such as open-field, hole-board, and finally in the plus-maze test.
